Name: suppurative thyroiditis
Definition: A Pseudomonas infectious disease that is caused by a Gram-negative bacterium Pseudomonas aeruginosa resulting in pulmonary edema. This bacterium releases immunogenic bacterial components that can gain access to airway epithelium and immune cells in the lung thus causing airway inflammation. P. aeruginosa is the common cause of hospital acquired and ventilator-associated pneumonias.

Definition: A Pseudomonas infectious disease that is caused by a Gram-negative bacterium Pseudomonas aeruginosa resulting in pulmonary edema. Name: subacute thyroiditis
Definition: A viral infectious disease that affects CD8 lymphocytes

Name: subacute lymphocytic thyroiditis
Definition: An autoimmune disease of blood that is characterized by deficient red blood cells caused by auto-antibodies.
